paragraphs.title: When
paragraphs.p: Each eigenvalue of A has its algebraic multiplicity equal to its geometric multiplicity. Additionally, if A is a real matrix and we would like both P and D to be real matrices, then we also need A to not have any complex eigenvalues.

paragraphs.title: How
paragraphs.p: Compute a basis for each eigenspace. Put these bases together into the columns of P.

paragraphs.title: Result
paragraphs.p: If the \nth[j] column of P is an eigenvector for eigenvalue \lambda, then the \nth[j] diagonal entry of D will be \lambda.
